settings.content: Handsling bikes are used at elite level in the ultimate test of performance and quality

Handsling frames are ridden to race wins in the junior ranks right through to elite level international competition. Riders consistently highlight the performance of their frame while providing feedback used in product development. From the origins of the brand in UK road racing to its present day global presence in multiple disciplines, Handsling is proudly race proven.

Ever since its launch, Handsling's frames have been ridden to race wins in the junior ranks right through to elite level. Handsling mounted riders past and present include the World Tour's Fred Wright, GB track star Oscar Nilsson-Julien, Pan Am track champ Amber Joseph and eight-time US national champion John Croom.

settings.title: Race winning from junior to elite
settings.content: Handsling frames have been ridden to race wins in the junior ranks right through to elite level. Handsling mounted riders past and present include the World Tour's Fred Wright, GB track star Oscar Nilsson-Julien, Pan Am track champ Amber Joseph and eight-time US national champion John Croom.

settings.title: Tested on the world stage
settings.content: Handsling frames have graced the most iconic cycling locations in the world, from London's Herne Hill to the cobbles of Paris-Roubaix. Their race pedigree in the hands of elite riders underscores the performance and durability of Handsling frames, while providing the feedback that guides product development.

settings.title: Supporting women's cycling
settings.content: This year Handsling has moved to support the global growth of women's cycling with its headline sponsorship of the DAS-Handsling UCI-registered continental pro team, which includes eite riders including GB's Sophie Lewis.

settings.title: Race proven from the outset
settings.content: From the origins of the brand in UK road racing to its present day global presence in multiple cycling disciplines, Handsling is proudly race proven.
This year Handsling has moved to support the global growth of women's cycling with its headline sponsorship of the CAMS continental pro team.

settings.text: British and UCI registered women’s continental cycling team

settings.content: DAS-Handsling is a British and UCI registered women’s continental cycling team, racing Handsling frames on road, track and cyclocross in the UK and across Europe. DAS-Handsling is the UK’s top ranked women’s team with overall victory in the 2022 UK National Road Series. Sophie Lewis raced her TR3evo in the 2022 UCI Track Champions League, picking up a standout Scratch Race win.

settings.text: From the very beginning, Handsling supports young aspiring riders.

settings.content:
UCI Continental Womens Team

DAS-Hutchinson-Brother is a UCI registered women’s continental cycling team, racing Handsling frames on road, track and cyclocross in the UK and across Europe. They are the UK’s top ranked women’s team with individual and team victory in the 2023 UK National Road Series.

settings.title: QOM and overall 2nd for Sammie Stuart
Lucy Lee bags a stage win

settings.content: US-based pro team CWD Cycling rides Handsling frames on road, track and gravel. The TR3evo was ridden to 16 medals at the 2022 USA National Track Championships at Elite and U23 level. Current US National Champions riding the TR3evo include Ian Anderson, Lance Abshire and Tristan Manderfeld. The team races the CEXevo in elite US gravel races including the 127-mile Rouge Roubaix. On the road, they ride the A1R0evo in the US crit series.

US-based pro team

CWD rides Handsling frames on road, track and gravel. The TR3evo was ridden to multiple medals at the 2023 USA National Track Championships. US National Champions riding the TR3evo include Ian Anderson, Lance Abshire and Tristan Manderfeld. The team races the CEXevo in elite US gravel races including the 127-mile Rouge Roubaix. On the road, they ride the A1R0evo in the US crit series.

settings.title: DAS-Handsling
settings.content: DAS-Handsling is a British and UCI registered women’s continental cycling team, racing Handsling frames on road, track and cyclocross in the UK and across Europe. DAS-Handsling is the UK’s top ranked women’s team with overall victory in the 2022 UK National Road Series. Sophie Lewis raced her TR3evo in the 2022 UCI Track Champions League, picking up a standout Scratch Race win.

settings.title: Chaney Windows & Doors Cycling
settings.content: US-based pro team CWD Cycling rides Handsling frames on road, track and gravel. The TR3evo was ridden to 16 medals at the 2022 USA National Track Championships at Elite and U23 level. Current US National Champions riding the TR3evo include Ian Anderson, Lance Abshire and Tristan Manderfeld. The team races the CEXevo in elite US gravel races including the 127-mile Rouge Roubaix. On the road, they ride the A1R0evo in the US crit series.

settings.title: South African National Team
settings.content: TR3evo riders Jose Kleinsmidt and Joshua Dike are the reigning African and South African champions. Jose is nine-time national champion and three time African champion, while Joshua is five time national champion and three time continental champion. Together they dominated the African Continental Track Championships 2022 riding their TR3evos.

settings.title: Czech National Team
settings.content: The TR3evo frame is used by elite Czech track star and multiple European track champion Tomas Babek. TR3evos are ridden by several members of the Czech team who featured strongly at the U23 Track European Championships in 2022.

settings.title: Alba
settings.content: Pair text with an image to focus on your chosen product, collection, or blog post. Add details on availability, style, or even provide a review.
Learn how we can personalise your bike to your performance needs

We run a professional workshop with full-time, detail oriented bike builders responsible for maintaining quality on all full builds. We are a small team and all the bikes are all built on site by skilled, experienced mechanics, and all are subject to a checklist before leaving the workshop.
Use this text to share information about your brand with your customers. Describe a product, share announcements, or welcome customers to your store.

settings.title: Fred Wright
settings.content: The current World Tour rider used Handsling frames in his junior days, riding junior classics such as Junior Paris Roubaix and Gent-Wevelgem, and winning the Tour of Wales, among others prestigious races.

settings.title: Oscar Nilsson-Julien
settings.content: Team GB’s Oscar rode Handsling track and road frames as a junior, winning numerous national titles.

settings.title: Catherine Coley
settings.content: Rode her Handsling track frame to two Masters World titles.

settings.title: Josh Giddings
settings.content: Up and coming Team GB track star rode his TR3evo to Madison and Team Pursuit gold in the U23 European Track Championships 2021.

settings.title: Amber Joseph
settings.content:
Olympic contender Amber Joseph of Barbados has ridden her TR3evo in multiple Track World Championships and is a multiple medal winner at the Pan American Track Championships, including a gold and two silvers in the 2022 edition.

#amberjoseph.1

settings.title: Tomáš Bábek
settings.content: Olympic track racer Tomáš uses the TR3evo in track bunch races and the A1R0evo on the road. Representing the Czech Republic, he is a multiple European Championships gold medalist and competed at the 2008 Summer Olympics.

settings.title: Sindre Haugsvaer
settings.content:
TR3evo rider Sindre is the current Norwegian elite champion in five endurance disciplines on the track - Scratch, Elimination, Points Race, Omnium and Individual Pursuit. 

#sindrehaugsvaer

settings.title: Jose Kleinsmidt
settings.content: Jose is the nine-time South African national track champion and three time African continental champion. Jose and compatriot Joshua Dike dominated the African Continental Track Championships 2022 riding their TR3evos.

settings.title: Sina Temmen
settings.content:
U23 track specialist and TR3evo rider Sina is two-time German Champion in the Omnium and one-time champion in Madison.

#sinalamaschina

settings.title: Sam Fisher
settings.content:
Sam is currently British Omnium champion, Scratch race champion, points race champion, Madison champion, and has set a new British record by more than 2 seconds for the individual pursuit. In 2023 he will be progressing to the Welsh and Great Britain teams at U18 level where he’ll be racing his TR3evo track bike.

#s.amfisher

settings.title: Katie-Ann Calton
settings.content: Katie-Ann rides Handsling frames on road, track and in cyclocross. She’s part of the Team GB youth set up and won team pursuit silver at the British National Track Championships 2022. She is reigning Herne Hill Velodrome Women’s League champion, a multiple winner in the Goodwood Summer Series, and 2021 Madison silver medalist at the Junior and Youth Nationals.

settings.title: Huw Buck
settings.content:
Huw is a regular at the UK Cyclo-Cross National Trophy, with consistent top ten positions. 2022 has been a breakthrough year for the Welshman, the highlight being GB selection for the UCI Cyclo-cross World Cup Maasmecheln, 2022 Cyclocross Koppenberg, and the European Championships Cyclocross Namur 2022. His most recent result was silver at the Welsh Cyclocross Championships 2022. 

#huw_buck24

settings.title: Jack Jee
settings.content:
U23 rider Jack entered cyclocross on a CEXevo in 2022 after years of success in elite mountain biking, where he reached the heights of a 6th place UK national ranking. He made a great start to his CX career, picking up strong results in the UK Cyclo-Cross National Trophy and at regional level. 

#jack_jee04

settings.title: Rory Gravelle
settings.content:
Rory was the fourth ranked youth rider in the UK for road and track in 2022. Part of the Welsh Pathway Programme, he won Madison bronze and Scratch silver in the 2022 National Youth and Junior Track Championships. On the A1R0evo, he has won multiple crits at National level. He’s also the U16 Welsh Cyclo-cross national champion on a CEXevo.

#rory.gravelle

settings.title: Barry Duplock
settings.content:
Endurance cyclist Barry Duplock rode his A1R0evo in the 2022 Transcontinental Race, which covers more than 4,000km across Europe. 

#barryonabike

settings.title: Amber Joseph - Track
settings.content: Olympic contender Amber Joseph of Barbados has ridden her TR3evo in multiple Track World Championships and is a multiple medal winner at the Pan American Track Championships, including a gold and two silvers in the 2022 edition.

settings.title: Tomáš Bábek - Track and Road
settings.content: Olympic track racer Tomáš uses the TR3evo in track bunch races and the A1R0evo on the road. Representing the Czech Republic, he is a multiple European Championships gold medalist and competed at the 2008 Summer Olympics.

settings.title: Sindre Haugsvaer - Track
settings.content: TR3evo rider Sindre is the current Norwegian elite champion in five endurance disciplines on the track - Scratch, Elimination, Points Race, Omnium and Individual Pursuit.

settings.title: Jose Kleinsmidt - Track
settings.content: Jose is the nine-time South African national track champion and three time African continental champion. Jose and compatriot Joshua Dike dominated the African Continental Track Championships 2022 riding their TR3evos.

settings.title: Sina Temmen - Track
settings.content: U23 track specialist and TR3evo rider Sina is two-time German Champion in the Omnium and one-time champion in Madison.

settings.title: Sam Fisher - Track
settings.content: Sam is currently British Omnium champion, Scratch race champion, points race champion, Madison champion, and has set a new British record by more than 2 seconds for the individual pursuit. In 2023 he will be progressing to the Welsh and Great Britain teams at U18 level where he’ll be racing his TR3evo track bike.

settings.title: Katie-Ann Calton - Road and Track
settings.content: Katie-Ann rides Handsling frames on road, track and in cyclocross. She’s part of the Team GB youth set up and won team pursuit silver at the British National Track Championships 2022. She is reigning Herne Hill Velodrome Women’s League champion and is a multiple winner in the Goodwood Summer Series.

settings.title: Huw Buck - Cyclocross and Road
settings.content: Huw is a regular at the UK Cyclo-Cross National Trophy, with consistent top ten positions. 2022 has been a breakthrough year for the Welshman, the highlight being GB selection for the UCI Cyclo-cross World Cup Maasmecheln, 2022 Cyclocross Koppenberg, and the European Championships Cyclocross Namur 2022. His most recent result was silver at the Welsh Cyclocross Championships 2022.

settings.title: Jack Jee - Cyclocross
settings.content: U23 rider Jack entered cyclocross on a CEXevo in 2022 after years of success in elite mountain biking, where he reached the heights of a 6th place UK national ranking. He made a great start to his CX career, picking up strong results in the UK Cyclo-Cross National Trophy and at regional level.

settings.title: Rory Gravelle - Road, Track and Cyclocross
settings.content: Rory was the fourth ranked youth rider in the UK for road and track in 2022. Part of the Welsh Pathway Programme, he won Madison bronze and Scratch silver in the 2022 National Youth and Junior Track Championships. On the A1R0evo, he has won multiple crits at National level. He’s also the U16 Welsh Cyclo-cross national champion on a CEXevo.

settings.title: Barry Duplock - Road
settings.content: Endurance cyclist Barry Duplock rode his A1R0evo in the 2022 Transcontinental Race, which covers more than 4,000km across Europe.

settings.title: Amalie Wither Olsen - Track
settings.content: An eight time Danish elite national champion on the track, where she rides the TR3evo and is part of the 'Handsling Twins' Madison duo. On the road she rides an A1R0evo for UCI Continental team Torelli.

settings.title: Francesca Selva - Track
settings.content: Italian pro cyclist and second Handsling twin specialising in endurance track events on her TR3evo. She represents her national team and has competed at prestigious events including Nations Cup and UCI Track Champions League.

settings.title: Amalie Cass - Track
settings.content: Millie is an elite paracyclist competing in international track events on her TR3evo. She represented GB in the 2023 World Championships across pursuit, scratch and omnium disciplines.

settings.title: Ryan Christensen - Gravel and Road
settings.content: A professional road and gravel cyclist from New Zealand riding A1R0evo and CEXevo frames. In 2024, he'll be racing in the UCI Gravel World Championships and the epic UNBOUND Gravel race.

settings.title: Ross Lamb - Road
settings.content: A professional road cyclist from Britain.
